newsitem.title: USA: Securities group praises House tax cut bill.
newsitem.headline: Securities group praises House tax cut bill.

text.p: The Securities Industry Association on Friday lauded the savings incentives provisions in a sweeping tax reform bill approved by the House Ways and Means Committee.

"The House Ways and Means Committee is to be congratulated for their efforts in approving some significant incentives to help all Americans save more for college, retirement, and other long-term financial goals," said SIA president Marc Lackritz, referring to the tax plan, which includes $85 billion in tax cuts over the next five years.

He highlighted provisions in the bill allowing individuals to set up education savings accounts with special tax breaks, the back-ended Individual Retirement Account (IRA), and a cut in capital gains tax rates both for individuals and corporations.

"The Committee also rolled back or eliminated a number of punitive taxes on savings and investment. If enacted, these proposals would have made it more difficult for companies to raise capital," Lackritz said.
SIA called on the Senate Finance Committee to expand some tax incentives in its tax plan to be considered next week.

"We are working with the Senate Finance Committee members, for example, to expand IRA eligibility so that the spouses of single-wage-earning couples can make a full $2,000 contribution to an IRA regardless of whether the income-earning spouse participates in a pension plan," Lackritz said.
